channel.title: Working out
channel.description: Anybody here do any power lifting or just regular body bulding? If so, say what you are, your max lifts (i.e. bench press, squat, dead lift, etc.), weight, and BMI.

item.title: Working out
item.dc:creator: @Chimaera_God Chimaera God
item.description:
@Chimaera_God wrote:

I rest only on days when I’m with my girlfriend. This little diet I’m going on this week is going to kill me, since I have to cut back on my calories but still work out mostly every day of the week along with jogging almost 2 miles home from the gym each time I work out.

I’m also walking to and back from school this week to burn extra calories. It’s about 2 miles to and back from my school, and 2 miles from the gym to my house, so I’ll be getting 4 miles of cardio in along with weight lifting and watching what I eat.

I hope to lose about 3 pounds by the end of Friday.

Read full topic

item.title: Working out
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“Stork, post:78, topic:186778”][quote author=Chimaera God link=topic=249292.msg2133603#msg2133603 date=1206415023]

If you’re doing a full body workout every day, you’re doing something wrong.

I do a full body workout every day, yet I vary some of the exercises when I work out. For example, every day when I squat, I’d do some shrugs to work my traps in between squat sets. Then the next day, I’d work on my delts instead of my traps in between sets.
[/quote]
So you do like different parts of each muscle group per day? That could work, never heard of it being done though.
Typically the workout is put into a split, so each day you do 2 different muscle groups, with rest days on the weekend.[/quote]
Yeah that’s what my trainer said. But since I train for the weekends, I usually train Monday lightly on Tuesday full on Wednesday and full on Thursday, and rest Friday.

Read full topic

item.title: Working out
item.dc:creator: @Chimaera_God Chimaera God
item.description:
@Chimaera_God wrote:

It’s been working for me. I used to to do the split workout regiment when I was playing football for my school, but that didn’t improve my muscles. So I came up with my own workout regiment.

Read full topic

item.title: Working out
item.dc:creator: @Chimaera_God Chimaera God
item.description:
@Chimaera_God wrote:

I’m sorry, meant to say “meeting” instead :D. You probably can’t since she’s only inviting people she knows, i.e. about 100 people. 30 guys, 70 girls, and only a few of those guys are actually getting into her house, the rest are being put in the backyard.

I didn’t know that she was throwing the party for me until a few days ago. I’m going to be the guest of honor or something of sorts. I don’t care about the party much though, as long as I get some alone time with my girl in her room :D.

EDIT: I’ll post a pic of me and her so you can see how gorgeous she is, but I’ll do it when I get home from school.

Read full topic

item.description:

Chimaera God:

Uh… I have to go on a mini diet this week. I weigh somewhere around 170, but want to lose a few pounds for this party on Saturday. Hitting the gym everyday this week, along with jogging, and basically eating fruit all the time.

Since when do you train for a party?

item.title: Working out
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

R.I.P RSC:

Do you guys know a way to get self discipline? I usually plan on training once in a while, like 50 sit ups a day, but after 2-3 days I quit again.

Look in the mirror every day and morning. Do you like the flabby fat cunt that is staring back at you? If you find you’re not working out or lack self discipline, take your shirt and pants off until you’re in your undies and run through perhaps a school with all of your mates. Embarrassed? There’s your motivation.[quote=“NewAgeMovement, post:27, topic:186778”]Do 25 push ups and rest for 1 minute. Then do again until you reach 100.
After a month or something do until you reach 200, and so on…
Do some other exercises with it because your titties will grow and if you dont do other excercises the other parts of your body won’t grow and you will look like a girl.
Other excercises : lifting weight, jogging, sit ups,
Ofcourse if there is a gym near your house then i suggest you go there.

It would fasten up the process of growing the muscles by buying some Creatine.
I heard there are no/few temporary side-effects.
I dont use creatine(yet) but i would suggest it.

The reason I don’t lift much is because I box. I don’t want these beastly, heavy arms, it just slows my punches. When I flex, my arm’s circumference is probably around 12 inches.

“Beastly, heavly arms”? I used to lift about 10kg for almost everyday for a year. Yes my muscles did grow but my arms didnt turn into beastly, heavly arms…
Now if i throw a punch at you i bet it would be harder then if you threw 3 punches at me.

A little thread hijack here. What is better to lose weight: 30 minutes of jogging/running or 30 minutes of cycling? I want to lose about 9 kg before summerbreak and I want to know wich one of the two is best/fastest.

30 minutes of running ofcourse. I suggest you run just after you wake up.
When you wake up and do excercises , the energy will be taken from your stored energy(your fat).[/quote]
Apparently you lose weight a lot quicker when you are hungry. I don’t exactly know if that’s true, though.

Read full topic

item.title: Working out
item.dc:creator: @Chimaera_God Chimaera God
item.description:
@Chimaera_God wrote:

R.I.P RSC:

Do you guys know a way to get self discipline? I usually plan on training once in a while, like 50 sit ups a day, but after 2-3 days I quit again.

Just kick yourself in the ass so you do it everyday. Or have somebody kick you in the ass for you.

Read full topic

item.title: Working out
item.dc:creator: @NewAgeMovement NewAgeMovement
item.description:
@NewAgeMovement wrote:

[quote=“Chimaera God, post:58, topic:186778”][quote author=NewAgeMovement link=topic=249292.msg2108483#msg2108483 date=1205530710]

^^

I have heavy arms from working out a lot since I the same exercises pretty much every day. It kinda sucks to have them so heavy. They’re nice and all, but I can’t even put my arm around my girlfriend’s shoulder if we’re sitting down cause they’re too big.

LOL

hmm i hope that was a joke.
Well, there’s no problem doing the same exercises everyday, as long as you work out your whole body instead of concentrating on one part of the body. It’s really ugly, some people concentrate too much on their upper body and forget about their lower body.

[/quote]

Half joke, half true lol.

I work out my entire body every day, my friends say I’m a beast.[/quote]
I’m doubting if training everyday is healthy for the muscles. The muscles need to recover , you know.

Read full topic
